class lib.twilio.Account(id, token)[source]¶

Twilio account object that provides helper functions for making REST requests to the Twilio API. This helper library works both in standalone python applications using the urllib/urlib2 libraries and inside Google App Engine applications using urlfetch.

request(path, method=None, vars={})[source]¶

sends a request and gets a response from the Twilio REST API

path: the URL (relative to the endpoint URL, after the /v1 url: the HTTP method to use, defaults to POST vars: for POST or PUT, a dict of data to send

returns Twilio response in XML or raises an exception on error

class lib.twilio.Conference(name, muted=None, beep=None, startConferenceOnEnter=None, endConferenceOnExit=None, waitUrl=None, waitMethod=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Specify conference in a nested Dial element.

name: friendly name of conference muted: keep this participant muted (bool) beep: play a beep when this participant enters/leaves (bool) startConferenceOnEnter: start conf when this participants joins (bool) endConferenceOnExit: end conf when this participants leaves (bool) waitUrl: TwiML url that executes before conference starts waitMethod: HTTP method for waitUrl GET/POST

class lib.twilio.Dial(number=None, action=None, method=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Dial another phone number and connect it to this call

action: submit the result of the dial to this URL method: submit to ‘action’ url using GET or POST

class lib.twilio.Gather(action=None, method=None, numDigits=None, timeout=None, finishOnKey=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Gather digits from the caller’s keypad

action: URL to which the digits entered will be sent method: submit to ‘action’ url using GET or POST numDigits: how many digits to gather before returning timeout: wait for this many seconds before returning finishOnKey: key that triggers the end of caller input

exception lib.twilio.HTTPErrorAppEngine[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Bases: urllib2.HTTPErrorProcessor

https_response(request, response)[source]¶
class lib.twilio.Hangup(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Hangup the call

class lib.twilio.Number(number, sendDigits=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Specify phone number in a nested Dial element.

number: phone number to dial sendDigits: key to press after connecting to the number

class lib.twilio.Pause(length=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Pause the call

length: length of pause in seconds

class lib.twilio.Play(url, loop=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Play audio file at a URL

url: url of audio file, MIME type on file must be set correctly loop: number of time to say this text

class lib.twilio.Record(action=None, method=None, maxLength=None, timeout=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Record audio from caller

action: submit the result of the dial to this URL method: submit to ‘action’ url using GET or POST maxLength: maximum number of seconds to record timeout: seconds of silence before considering the recording complete

class lib.twilio.Redirect(url=None, method=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Redirect call flow to another URL

url: redirect url

class lib.twilio.Reject(reason=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Reject an incoming call

reason: message to play when rejecting a call

class lib.twilio.Response(version=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Twilio response object.

version: Twilio API version e.g. 2008-08-01

class lib.twilio.Say(text, voice=None, language=None, loop=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Say text

text: text to say voice: MAN or WOMAN language: language to use loop: number of times to say this text

class lib.twilio.Sms(msg, to=None, sender=None, method=None, action=None, statusCallback=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lib.twilio.Verb

Send a Sms Message to a phone number

to: whom to send message to, defaults based on the direction of the call sender: whom to send message from. action: url to request after the message is queued method: submit to ‘action’ url using GET or POST statusCallback: url to hit when the message is actually sent

exception lib.twilio.TwilioException[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

class lib.twilio.TwilioUrlRequest(url, data=None, headers={}, origin_req_host=None, unverifiable=False)[source]¶

Bases: urllib2.Request

get_method()[source]¶
class lib.twilio.Utils(id, token)[source]¶
validateRequest(uri, postVars, expectedSignature)[source]¶

validate a request from twilio

uri: the full URI that Twilio requested on your server postVars: post vars that Twilio sent with the request expectedSignature: signature in HTTP X-Twilio-Signature header

returns true if the request passes validation, false if not
